title: HOW TO BUILD THE ULTIMATE NO-TILL GARDEN: USING COVER CROPS AS A SHEET MULCH!

tasks.task: Clearing land for a no-till garden
subtasks: Ordering silage tarps from a supplier
Measuring and marking garden bed dimensions
Applying silage tarps to kill weeds and grass
Planting cover crops such as rye grass
Grinding down cover crops using a pallet
Applicating compost on the prepared land
Broadcasting rye grass seed after soaking with rain

tasks.task: Crimping down silage tarps to create a mulch mat
subtasks: Marking the perimeter of the garden beds
Crimping tarps along the perimeter of the beds
Pulling back the tarp to reveal the seedling layer
Adding wood chips to the garden walkways

tasks.task: Planting vegetables into the prepared beds
subtasks: Digging planting holes and inserting seedlings
Watering the newly planted garden
Regularly checking for weeds and removing them
Applying additional compost as needed
Monitoring rainfall and adjusting planting schedules
Protecting the garden from pests and wildlife

tasks.task: Ensuring proper irrigation for the garden
subtasks: Installing and maintaining a watering system
Regularly checking for soil moisture levels
Adjusting watering schedules based on weather conditions
